name: Ice-Fishing Man
description: Frozen pond with cabin on left edge, dark green trees at bottom and right. Man sitting on chair ice-fishing, line taut. Sky mirrors the ice.
key_elements: frozen pond, cabin, dark trees, ice-fishing man, hole in ice
missing_piece: The hole where the fishing line drops through
narrative_role: Central riddle of Cassie's first tutoring session. The missing hole piece is deliberate.
notes: Man occupies 8 pieces. Cassie names him 'Paul.' Located on card table in Vivian's living room.

name: Pirate Puzzle
description: Captain Hook with treasure map and hook hand, looking over shoulder. Two crew members digging in treasure chest. Ship in bay, seagulls, overcast sky.
key_elements: Captain Hook, treasure map with X, gold earring, red coat, treasure chest, ship
narrative_role: Little Porn's primary example for developing puzzle language. 104 pieces (13x8).
notes: Each piece given a name from 104-word vocabulary. X on map named 'dame'. Hook tip named 'sim'.

name: Ballerinas
description: Kid puzzle with ballerinas. Thick, glossy, big pieces.
narrative_role: Has letters written on the back of each piece. Falls on Cassie's head from closet.
notes: When Cassie does the puzzle, every piece has a letter on the back.

name: Escher Stairs
description: M.C. Escher impossible staircase. Last piece is blank whiteness.
key_elements: impossible stairs, Escher style, blank white section
narrative_role: Completed by Little Porn at age 4. After finishing, he signed that he was done with puzzles.
notes: Traumatic puzzle that made Little Porn refuse puzzles until Vivian.

name: Fun Town (Ravensburger 12761)
description: 12 pieces wide, 17 high. Used as formal example in puzzle language inscription.
key_elements: formal notation example, sky pieces, mountain peaks, clouds
narrative_role: Earliest surviving Little Porn inscription. Shows pre-CSQ nomenclature.
notes: Can no longer be found outside museums. Originally appeared in newspaper 'Guess the Pattern' section.

name: Mushrooms and Castle
description: Mushrooms and flowers with castle in distance.
narrative_role: Mentioned as example puzzle, not central to narrative.
notes: Referenced in fragment about puzzle piece categories.

name: Van Gogh (Kitchen)
description: Half-done Van Gogh puzzle on Vivian's kitchen table.
narrative_role: Shows Vivian's multiple puzzle setup—different puzzle on each table.
notes: Cassie notices Vivian has puzzles on kitchen table and dining room table.

name: Rembrandt (Kitchen)
description: Half-done Rembrandt puzzle, mostly a black cloud.
narrative_role: Alternative description of kitchen puzzle (Van Gogh/Rembrandt inconsistency in ore).
notes: Ore contains both Van Gogh and Rembrandt as kitchen puzzle—narrative inconsistency.
